alert.note: Alert for Perry; Stone (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 4:30PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Perry and northwestern Stone Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 429 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms 8 miles east of Brooklyn, or 13 miles northeast of Wiggins, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Perry and northwestern Stone Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
